attributes.action: instruct the Chancellor of the Exchequer to accept the resignations of the Board of Directors of The Royal Bank of Scotland.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Board of Directors of The Royal Bank of Scotland have threatened to resign unless Alistair Darling allows them reward senior staff with large bonuses.

The Chancellor must immediately accept these resignations as an indication that the Government are serious about curbing the excesses of the banking industry.

The current recession was precipitated by the actions of the finance industry and has resulted in reduced incomes for many.

If the Board of RBS are unable to see how utterly unacceptable it is to award these bonuses at a time of rising unemployment, not least amongst rank and file bank staff, then they clearly lack the vision needed to direct a bank that is 80% state owned.
